Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXController

  • @Target(TYPE)
@Documented
@Retention(RUNTIME)
public @interface AFXController
    Annotation for ActionFX controllers to associate and manage a view togehter with it.
    Author:
    MartinKoster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String fxml
      Path to the FXML file to load for this view.
      java.lang.String viewId
      The ID of the view.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      int height
      The height of the window (however maximized has a higher priority).
      java.lang.String icon
      The icon to be displayed in case the view is displayed in its own stage.
      boolean lazyInit
      Flag that controls the initialization of the view and controller.
      boolean maximized
      Specifies whether this view shall be displayed maxized or not.
      boolean modal
      Specifies whether this view is a modal dialog or a regular window.
      AFXNestedView[] nestedViews
      An optional list of nested views that shall be embedded in the view.
      int posX
      The X position of the window on the screen.
      int posY
      The Y position of the window on the screen.
      boolean singleton
      Determines whether the view is managed as singleton or not.
      java.lang.String[] stylesheets
      Which stylesheets shall be applied to the scene?
      java.lang.String title
      The title to be displayed for the given view/window.
      int width
      The width of the view (however maximized has a higher priority).

    • Element Detail

      • viewId

        java.lang.String viewId
        The ID of the view. Must be unique among all views of this application.
        Returns:
        the view ID

      • fxml

        java.lang.String fxml
        Path to the FXML file to load for this view. Path is relative to the application's classpath.
        Returns:
        the path to the FXML file

      • modal

        boolean modal
        Specifies whether this view is a modal dialog or a regular window. Default is false.
        Returns:
        true, if this view is a modal dialogue, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • maximized

        boolean maximized
        Specifies whether this view shall be displayed maxized or not. Default is false.
        Returns:
        true, whether the view shall be maximized, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • width

        int width
        The width of the view (however maximized has a higher priority).
        Returns:
        the width of the view
        Default:
        200

      • height

        int height
        The height of the window (however maximized has a higher priority).
        Returns:
        the height of the view
        Default:
        100

      • title

        java.lang.String title
        The title to be displayed for the given view/window.
        Returns:
        the title of the window
        Default:
        ""

      • posX

        int posX
        The X position of the window on the screen.
        Returns:
        the X position
        Default:
        0

      • posY

        int posY
        The Y position of the window on the screen.
        Returns:
        the Y position
        Default:
        0

      • icon

        java.lang.String icon
        The icon to be displayed in case the view is displayed in its own stage.
        Returns:
        the location of the icon
        Default:
        ""

      • singleton

        boolean singleton
        Determines whether the view is managed as singleton or not. If the view is not a singleton, the view is newly created whenever it is requested.
        Returns:
        true, if the view is managed as singleton, false, if there is a new view created every time the view is requested.
        Default:
        true

      • lazyInit

        boolean lazyInit
        Flag that controls the initialization of the view and controller. If set to true, view components are lazily initialized at the point the view is really required and requested to be used vie the view manager. If set to {@link false}, the view components are initialized at the startup of the ActionFX application, when the view manager is initialized. Although lazy loading should be preferred, disabling of lazy loading makes sense, when you want to have a fail-early fail-fast pattern and exceptions during view initializations should/must be thrown at application startup (and not later, when you already work with the application).
        Returns:
        true (default), when view components should be lazily initialized, false otherwise
        Default:
        true

      • stylesheets

        java.lang.String[] stylesheets
        Which stylesheets shall be applied to the scene? This array contains a list of classpath locations to CSS files.
        Returns:
        a list of CSS classpath locations. Default is an empty array.
        Default:
        {}

      • nestedViews

        AFXNestedView[] nestedViews
        An optional list of nested views that shall be embedded in the view.
        Returns:
        the nested views to be embedded
        Default:
        {}
